intro: Tupistra khasiana, commonly known as the Khasi spurge, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and striking yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and mountainous areas, adapting well to harsh environmental conditions. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats and is valued for its ornamental appearance. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
